byline.contributor: Alan Blinder reported from Atlanta, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York.
byline.original: By ALAN BLINDER and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Georgia Gov Nathan Deal pledges to veto religious freedom bill intended to protect critics of same-sex marriage, dealing striking blow to religious conservatives.

headline.print_headline: Georgia Governor Rejects Bill Shielding Critics of Same-Sex Marriage
headline.main: Georgia Governor Rejects Bill Shielding Critics of Gay Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

snippet: Gov. Nathan Deal said he would veto a measure to protect religious groups that refuse to provide “social, educational or charitable services that violate” their beliefs.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Nathan Deal said he would veto a measure to protect religious groups that refuse to provide “social, educational or charitable services that violate” their beliefs.
